content:
Yes, certainly! Here are some good guides for people looking to improve their pixel art skills using Aseprite:

1. Pixel Art Tutorial - Aseprite Basics: This tutorial series by MortMort is a comprehensive guide to Aseprite and pixel art, covering the basics of the software and techniques for creating effective pixel art. The series includes topics such as color theory, shading, and animation, and provides clear and detailed explanations of each concept. Link: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzQgPvSn_Pk&list=PLvJ2P-uz-KcSbD7XUADVjIOGRL_FZuLJ4>
2. Aseprite Pixel Art Tutorial Series: This tutorial series by Pixel Pete is designed for beginners to pixel art and Aseprite. It covers the basics of creating pixel art, including creating shapes, shading, and animation, and provides step-by-step guidance on each topic. The series is well-organized and easy to follow, and provides helpful tips and tricks throughout. Link: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BRI-7JEU0Rw&list=PLMZ_9wWVdmFwRnztRQC2Lk8X05NcG-S25>
3. Aseprite Tutorial: Tips and Tricks for Beginners: This tutorial by Nadya Lev is a quick and informative guide to using Aseprite for pixel art. It covers topics such as creating palettes, using layers, and creating animations, and provides tips and tricks for improving your pixel art skills. The tutorial is well-structured and provides clear explanations of each concept. Link: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uX8A9_rCIC0>
4. Aseprite Tutorial - Character Animation: This tutorial by Sander Lindemann is focused on creating character animations using Aseprite. It covers topics such as creating keyframes, using layers, and creating motion paths, and provides step-by-step guidance on creating a simple animation. The tutorial is well-paced and provides clear explanations of each concept. Link: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBHCkceuu9I>

These are just a few examples of the many good guides available for learning pixel art using Aseprite. I hope you find them helpful in improving your skills!
